SEARCH
Package de.tha.tools

Class Window

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
de.tha.tools.Window
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public class Window extends Frame
The Window class provides a graphical window for drawing various shapes. It manages drawable objects such as circles, rectangles, triangles, polygons, and lines, and offers various methods for creating, positioning, and configuring these shapes.

This class also handles user interactions, such as mouse clicks, key presses, and mouse wheel movements. It supports drawing with optional borders and various colors and can capture the window content as a PNG image.

Usage:

  • Initialize the window using one of the initWindow methods.
  • Create shapes using methods like drawCircle, drawRectangle, drawLine, and more.
  • Configure shapes' position, color, and border settings.
  • Use the draw() method to repaint the window when in manual paint mode.
  • Capture the window content as an image file using saveAsPNG.

Note:

This class is designed to manage a single instance (singleton) of a graphical window. The static methods rely on this singleton instance for drawing and manipulation.
See Also:

    • draw

      public static void draw()
      Triggers a repaint of the window, drawing all drawable elements in the current list.

    • saveAsPNG

      public void saveAsPNG(String filename)
      Saves the current content of the window as a PNG image file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to save as PNG
